name: You're Bad At Math
description:
You’re Bad at Math. The only question is, how bad are you? Let’s find out, shall we? Blocks fall from the top of the screen to the bottom. The object of the game is to line up 3 blocks that add up to the number displayed in the bottom right corner of the screen. Try to get the highest score you can! Press the Red Bomb Button to clear the screen of blocks, but be careful, using a bomb will cost you points! You can play a small Campaign Mode with set features, or Quick Play that lets you customize your game. Custom features include selecting music, backgrounds, and the speed at which the block fall, Slow, Normal, or Fast. You can also set the number you wish to add to, from 5 to 12 or higher numbers like 15, 20, 25.

Then there’s Chaos Mode, in this mode, the number to add to CHANGES every few seconds. This mode will really challenge your brain as you have to do quick thinking to stay alive!

But what if things get too difficult? That's why you have BOMBS! Use a bomb to clear the board to give yourself more time! There’s only one thing left you can do, try it out for yourself. See if you’re better at math than your friends or family, who knows, maybe you’re bad at math? Let’s find out.

Controls:

Keyboard

  • Left and Right arrows will move the cursor for blocks to fall. You can also use the mouse to click on the row you wish for the block to fall.
  • X will Pause the game, so will clicking the "Pause Button"
  • Q or W will drop a bomb, and so will pushing the "Bomb Button"

Controller

  • D- Pad or L stick will move the cursor left or right.
  • Right Button will Pause the game.
  • Left or Right Bumper will drop a bomb.

Mobile

  • Push the left or right arrows to move the cursor, or touch the block in the row you wish for the block to fall.
  • Push the pause button onscreen to pause.
  • Push the Bomb button onscreen to drop a bomb.
  • (In the Options Menu, it is recommended to select "Fast" for Cursor Sensitivity)
This game is mobile friendly! Play it on the go!

(This game is still in development)
